titleStmt.title: Enumeration of Simple Complete Topological Graphs

analytic.title: Enumeration of Simple Complete Topological Graphs

application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

div.p: T (n) = number of isomorphism classes T w (n) = number of weak isomorphism classes of simple complete topological graphs on n vertices Theorem [J. Pach, G. Tóth, 2004]:
div.formula: 2 Ω(n 2 ) ≤ T w (n) ≤ 2 O(n 2 log n)
T max w (n) ≥ e c √ n

div.head: Proof of Theorem 1
div.formula: T (n) ≥ 2 Ω(n 4 ) V 0 V 1 V 2 V 3 V 4 V 5 C 0 C 1 C 2 Upper bound: T (n) ≤ 2 O(n 4 )
div.p: Proposition: There is a two-to-one correspondence between rotation systems and weak isomorphism classes of simple complete topological graphs.

div.head: star-cut representation:
div.p: Upper bound: T (n) ≤ 2 O(n 4 ) Proposition: There is a two-to-one correspondence between rotation systems and weak isomorphism classes of simple complete topological graphs.

div.head: star-cut representation:
div.p: Upper bound: T (n) ≤ 2 O(n 4 ) Proposition: There is a two-to-one correspondence between rotation systems and weak isomorphism classes of simple complete topological graphs.

div.head: star-cut representation:
div.formula: v w 1 w 2 w 3 w 4 v 1 v 4 v 3 v 2 w 1 w 2 w 3 w 4
div.p: Proposition: The number of non-isomorphic simple arrangements of n pseudochords with fixed perimetric order inducing k crossings is at most 2 k .

figure.figDesc: Lower bounds are attained even for extendable graphs Remark: The number of weak isomorphism classes of complete geometric graphs on n vertices is 2 O(n log n) Graphs with maximum number of crossings T max w (n) = number of weak isomorphism classes of simple complete topological graphs on n vertices with n 4 crossings Theorem [H. Harborth, I. Mengersen, 1992]:
O(n 2 log n) weak isomorphism classes O(n 3 ) pseudochords ⇒ 2 O(n 3 log n) perimetric orders O(n 4 ) crossings ⇒ 2 O(n 4 ) arrangements ⇒ 2 O(n 4 ) isomorphism classes
